info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:49PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Montgomery, east central Chester, southwestern Philadelphia and Delaware Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lima, or 10 miles east of West Chester. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Chester, Yeadon, Folcroft, Swarthmore, Narberth, East Lansdowne, Darby Township, Morris Park, Bryn Mawr, Trout Lake, Chelsea, Radnor Township, Gradyville, Broomall, Newtown Square, Roxborough, Drexel Hill, Lima and Nether Providence Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 7 and 13. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 337 and 339. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
